summary: The concept of "election campaign" pertains to the structured activities undertaken by candidates or political entities to influence voters during electoral procedures within the European Union. Governed by various legal frameworks, including the EU's electoral regulations, these campaigns are critical for ensuring democratic participation and transparency. They encompass a range of activities, from public speeches to media engagement, all aimed at garnering support. The regulatory context emphasizes compliance with principles such as fairness and equal opportunity, ensuring that all candidates can effectively communicate their platforms. Thus, election campaigns are integral to the integrity of the electoral process in the EU.
